attributes.action: Help Kevin Taylor bring his wife and daughters to the UK. Humanitarian reasons.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2008 they set up a visa consultancy.
In 2009 they were arrested.
In 2014 they were convicted of simple illegal recruitment and estafa. It was never proved that they recruited anyone, but the judge convicted them on a technicality, they never had a licence to process work visas. They had bad advice from the poea, who said they never needed a licence.
They are now awaiting their appeal for executive clemency. And Kevin will be deported never to see his girls again. Kevin's almost blind.
attributes.background: Kevin and Charlene Taylor have been in jail in the Philippines for six years, for a crime they barely knew about. Kevin's almost blind now, he will be deported from the Philippines, he and Charlene have three girls, please allow them entry to the UK with their mother. They been apart for so long.

rejection.details:
It's not clear what help you would like the UK Government to offer. 

A petition may not be the most effective way of achieving what you would like. In addition to petitioning, you may also want to contact the Foreign Office directly, if you haven't already done so:

https://www.gov.uk/government/world/organisations/british-embassy-manila
